snippet: Sheik Hazem Salah Abu Ismail, an ultraconservative Islamist at the front of Egypt’s presidential race, may not be able to run because his mother became an American citizen before she died.
abstract: Sheik Hazem Salah Abu Ismail, an ultraconservative Islamist at the front of Egypt’s presidential race, may not be able to run because his mother became an American citizen before she died, which would disqualify him from the race under current Egyptian law; his exit would again scramble the race to become president and set the template for Egypt’s future leadership.

byline.contributor: Sheelagh McNeill contributed reporting from New York, and Mayy El Sheikh from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Sheik Hazem Salah Abu Ismail, an ultraconservative Islamist at the front of Egypt’s presidential race, may not be able to run because his mother became an American citizen before she died.

headline.seo: Mother’s U.S. Citizenship May Disqualify Egyptian Candidate
headline.main: Anti-American Egyptian Candidate May Be Tripped Up by Mother’s U.S. Ties
headline.print_headline: Anti-American Egyptian Candidate May Be Tripped Up by Mother’s U.S. Ties
